alert.note: Alert for Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 3:48PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa County through 430 PM MST... At 347 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking outflow winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Horseshoe Reservoir to near Rio Verde to near Goldfield Ranch. Movement was west at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Scottsdale, Fountain Hills, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Deer Valley Airport, McDowell Mountain Park, North Mountain Park, Goldfield Ranch, Desert Mountain, Scottsdale Airport, Desert Ridge Marketplace, Camp Creek, Rio Verde, Horseshoe Reservoir, Fort McDowell, Anthem and Seven Springs. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 210 and 241. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 10 and 15. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 189 and 197. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MST for south central Arizona.

area.areaDesc: Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River
